info.name: LibraryAPIReference
info.description:
This is an API reference for the Library API used in API 101.

You can see the Glitch code for the API [here](https://glitch.com/edit/#!/postman-library-api).

exec: pm.test("List of books contains results", function () {
pm.test("Response contains objects with expected schema", function () {
pm.test("Last object from response has expected values", function () {
pm.test("Set book id as environment variable", function() {

request.description:
Returns all books in the library database. 

Optional filters can be passed as query parameters.

response.name: books

query.description: a search string to be matched against author/title (example: borges). Case insensitive, partial match OK.

response.body:
[
    {
        "title": "Ficciones",
        "author": "Jorge Luis Borges",
        "id": "ZUST9JFx-Sd9X0k",

item.name: Filter books with query parameter checkedOut

exec: pm.test("List of books contains results", function () {
pm.test("Response contains objects with expected schema", function () {
pm.test("Response contains only books with checkedOut : false", function () {
pm.test("Set book id as environment variable", function() {

request.description:
Returns all books matching checkedOut criteria

Optional filters can be passed as query parameters.

response.name: books

request.description:
### Update a book by id

Update any of these fields for a book with given `id` via the JSON body: 

- `title` (string)
- `author` (string)
- `genre` (string)
- `yearPublished` (integer)
- `checkedOut` (boolean)

> Note: **Only user-added books can be edited**. Some books are part of the library's canonical collection and cannot be edited.

exec: pm.test("Response has expected values (after book was updated)", function () {

request.description: Gets a single book by id

item.name: Add book: case without required parameter title

request.description: Adds a book to the Library. Books added by users are deleted from the library 12 hours after they have been created.

item.name: Add book: case yearPublished is not integer

request.description: Adds a book to the Library. Books added by users are deleted from the library 12 hours after they have been created.

item.name: Read one book by unexistent id

request.description: Gets a single book by id

### Update a book by id

Update any of these fields for a book with given `id` via the JSON body: 

- `title` (string)
- `author` (string)
- `genre` (string)
- `yearPublished` (integer)
- `checkedOut` (boolean)

> Note: **Only user-added books can be edited**. Some books are part of the library's canonical collection and cannot be edited.
Adds a book to the Library. Books added by users are deleted from the library 12 hours after they have been created.

request.description:
### Update a book by id

Update any of these fields for a book with given `id` via the JSON body: 

- `title` (string)
- `author` (string)
- `genre` (string)
- `yearPublished` (integer)
- `checkedOut` (boolean)

> Note: **Only user-added books can be edited**. Some books are part of the library's canonical collection and cannot be edited.

exec: pm.expect(jsonData["message"]).to.eql("You can't delete this book! It is part of the canonical library collection. You can delete books that you have added.");
